name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Washington, DC/New York Avenue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here for one night when our son had surgery at Washington Medstar hospital. It was about 2 miles from the hospital. I made a reservation through their 800 number a few days before the surgery & was glad I did since we checked in after 10 pm. The front desk person, a nice young lady, was very good & took the time to find us a room that was quiet. That was very appreciated!
reviews.title: Just fine

reviews.text: Our room was a standard room with a king size bed. It had a fridge, microwave, coffee pot, flat screen TV, nice dresser with deep drawers, 2 night stands, clock with docking station, excellent lighting in the bathroom & a hair dryer. It did not have a full length mirror. The breakfast was good & I believe they started serving at 5 am. The one negative is that our room had a fragrance smell that did not dissipate. I am not a fan of fragrances. Many fragrances cause my head to become congested. Fortunately this one did not.
reviews.title: Ummm, this is a hard one. Can I do a 3.5 instead?

reviews.text: I will be objective about this place. Let's start with the negatives:
reviews.title: Staff and room exceed expectations

reviews.text: *Location sucks. Bad. We were here for a conference at the convention center in Mt. Vernon. We drove. Never again ghostwriter. Traffic drains the living life out of your mind, body, and soul. I see why the shuttle doesn't operate between noon and 5. (or at all) We never got a chance to ride it because the times we needed it, it wasn't active. I did like the Checkers across the street! If you aren't used to the low income hood energy, then this gentrified sections will scare you. lol. Also, we soon found that Stadium Nightclub is right around the corner though. Nice! Nevertheless, we cancelled our stay earlier and went elsewhere because getting to this place was just a hassle via shuttle or taxi. Otherwise things were great.
reviews.title: Nice rooms-- great breakfast-- great location

reviews.text: Postives:
reviews.title: Won't Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through Hotels.com When we arrived late at night I was greeted by Evan, the night manager. He was extremely friendly and helpful despite the litany of things that were being thrown at him at once. He was quite the multi-tasker. Upon entering our room we discovered that instead of being a room with a King size bed, it had two queens. I went back downstairs and barely explained it to Evan. In no time he had us set up in a King size suite for the same money. No muss, no fuss. It was very much appreciated. He was a class act.
reviews.title: Extremely Pleased

reviews.text: The room was huge, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and the staff was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Very nice people, not real convenient w/o a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were only two negatives we encountered. One, there were a lot of sirens at night. I realize this has nothing to do with the hotel, but it may be annoying to some guests. We also had a window overlooking the street, so I am sure a room towards the back of the hotel would be quieter. Also, there were no blackout curtains in our room (or at least none I could find).
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.text: All and all, we were very happy and would certainly return.
reviews.title: Nice stay with indoor pool

reviews.text: The staff was so nice and helpful but for our family vacationing in DC to see the museums and the memorials, it wasn't ideal.
reviews.title: Nice rooms....but that's about it

reviews.text: NY Ave at Bladensburg used to be a scary neighborhood in DC around 1990s, second class motels and not much available. That has changed and I highly recommend the Fairfield Inn here. There are two properties adjoining, a Holiday Inn Express and Fairfield; the area is well loghted and secure, set well back from the road.
reviews.title: Used to be Scary

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a minisuite, parking charge was much more reasonable than more downtown locations ($15 v $33 at the Courtyard on NY and Fla) The price was reasonable at about $105 plus tax and parking. We have stayed at Courtyard Navy Yard, Courtyard at NY and Fla and in Pentagon City. This was much better for our needs and much more reasonably priced
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but...

reviews.text: Excellent free wifi, good breakfast.
reviews.title: Overall average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative is that it is not convenient to the Metro. If you are here as a tourist, headed to the Mall and sites, you will have to drive. Our visit was for family, just a 10 minute drive to Rhode Island Ave.
reviews.title: Met our needs just fine--only a couple of suggestions for improvements!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not fancy but a great value.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, below average service

reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! When it comes to lodging in Washington, THIS IS THE PLACE. From start to finish, you are well taken care of. Friendly and knowledgeable staff greet you and make you feel welcome. What is a nice touch is that they acknowledge you as an Elite member (if this applies). The rooms are VERY clean and comfortable. Parking is never an issue. One of the best features of the hotel is its location. Its right at the beginning of the Balto-Wash Pkwy, which means, when i'm done with my visit, I'm on my way, not having to navigate through One Way's and Delivery trucks and the occasional Road Closure. And..... I'm minutes from Downtown and all the museums. Home away from Home. I LOVE THIS PLACE! and when you stay, You'll love it, too.
reviews.title: The Best.

reviews.text: On one of the busiest and monumental weekends of the year, Presidential Inauguration, 4 adults and a teen stayed very comfortably in a 2 qn bed and pull out couch. The tv wasn't working but we called downstairs and they immediately came up to fix the issue! Staff helped us navigate from the hotel via the bus and metro system to get to the National Mall. I would definitely stay here again. Breakfast was good. There is a KFC/taco bell across the street and checkers across the other side of the street. Now don't be alarmed as you are driving into the area but that is DC! But I loved it!
reviews.title: Very Clean and friendly staff

reviews.text: This place is a diamond in the rough. Is overall completely enjoyable to my family and I as we traveled to Washington D.C.
reviews.title: Diamond in the Rough

reviews.text: Upon arrival, I came into a clean and cozy hotel. The Front Desk Manager, that checked my family and I in, greeted me with a warm and friendly smile. The room was immaculate and smelled wonderful. I dislike like the space where the chair was located in our room 510, it’s really cramped in between the wall and the bed. I had a room with a two queen beds equipped with a microwave oven and a refrigerator. This was excellent for our weekend get a way.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.text: I called downstairs for some cleaning products the morning of my check out for the bathroom. The housekeeper came up within 30 minutes of my call and thoroughly cleansed the bathroom which exceeded my expectation and made my day. The Rector family will return.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Excellent Customer Service

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Washington, Dc/New York Avenue Hotel
description: Welcome to the Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Washington DC/New York Avenue; the first Fairfield Inn by Marriott in Washington, DC. The hotel has 126 guestrooms and suites, complimentary hot breakfast, and free shuttle service to Union Station Amtrak and the Walter E Washington Convention Center. The hotel is centrally located near three major airports: Ronald Reagan National Airport, Baltimore-Washington International Airport, Washington Dulles International Airport. The Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Washington DC/New York Avenue is ideal for travelers visiting Washington's historic attractions, monuments and other hidden treasures waiting to be discovered throughout the Smithsonians 19 museums.
